TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit PackWebRequest extends System.Net.WebRequest

Docs.summary: Makes a request to an entire or to a in a package, identified by a pack URI.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.IO.Packaging> [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_api#plural](~/includes/tla2sharptla-apisharpplural-md.md)] use a defined pack uri syntax to refer to parts that are contained in a package.
For more information about the abstract class that this class derives from and the operation of requests and responses, see <xref:System.Net.WebRequest>.

MemberSignature.Value: public override System.Net.Cache.RequestCachePolicy CachePolicy { get; set; }

Docs.value: The to use with pack URI web request.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackWebRequest.CachePolicy%2A> property is distinct from the <xref:System.Net.WebRequest.CachePolicy%2A> of the inner <xref:System.Net.WebRequest> returned by the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackWebRequest.GetInnerRequest%2A> method.

Docs.exception: The specified to set is not valid.

MemberSignature.Value: public override string ConnectionGroupName { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the connection group.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackWebRequest.ConnectionGroupName%2A> property enables the request to be associated with a connection group. A connection group is useful when application makes requests to the same server for different users.
The <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackWebRequest.ConnectionGroupName%2A> property is an empty string if the request resolves from the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackageStore> cache.
The <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackWebRequest.ConnectionGroupName%2A> property is shared with the inner <xref:System.Net.WebRequest> (<xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackWebRequest.GetInnerRequest%2A>).

MemberSignature.Value: public override long ContentLength { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the Content-length [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_http](~/includes/tlasharptla-http-md.md)] header.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Note that the pack URI protocol does not process information in the request other than the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_uri](~/includes/tlasharptla-uri-md.md)]. For most traditional purposes (such as estimating the size of POST information), there is no need for this property.
<xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackWebRequest.ContentLength%2A> returns 0 if the request resolves from the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackageStore> cache.
The <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackWebRequest.ContentLength%2A> property is shared with the inner <xref:System.Net.WebRequest> (<xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackWebRequest.GetInnerRequest%2A>).

Docs.exception: Set is not supported, is read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: public override string ContentType { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the Content-type [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_http](~/includes/tlasharptla-http-md.md)] header.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Note that the pack URI protocol does not process information in the request other than the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_uri](~/includes/tlasharptla-uri-md.md)]. For most purposes (such as determining the type of POST information), there is no use for this property.
<xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackWebRequest.ContentType%2A> returns an empty string if the request resolves from the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackageStore> cache.
The <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackWebRequest.ContentType%2A> property is shared with the inner <xref:System.Net.WebRequest> (<xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackWebRequest.GetInnerRequest%2A>).

MemberSignature.Value: public override System.Net.ICredentials Credentials { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the authentication credentials.
Docs.value: The authentication credentials to use with the request.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Requests to the package cache use their own cached credentials.
The <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackWebRequest.Credentials%2A> property is shared with the inner <xref:System.Net.WebRequest> (<xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackWebRequest.GetInnerRequest%2A>).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Net.WebRequest GetInnerRequest() cil managed

Docs.returns: A created from the inner-URI if the request resolves to a valid transport protocol such http or ftp; or a created with a null-URI if the request resolves from the cache.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackWebRequest.GetInnerRequest%2A> is provided for advanced scenarios only and is not needed for normal operation.

Docs.exception: The inner URI does not resolve to a valid transport protocol such as http for ftp, nor can the request be resolved from the .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.IO.Stream GetRequestStream() cil managed

Docs.summary: Do not use— is not supported by .
Docs.returns: If is called, a is thrown.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackWebRequest.GetRequestStream%2A> exists to implement the contract required by the abstract base class. The pack URI protocol does not support writing.

Docs.exception: Occurs on any call to . The pack URI protocol does not support writing.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Net.WebResponse GetResponse() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the response stream for the request.
Docs.returns: The response stream for the request.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Per the signature of the base class, <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackWebRequest.GetResponse%2A> returns value of type <xref:System.Net.WebResponse>. The return value it is actually of type <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackWebResponse> specific to the response of the pack URI protocol.
The <xref:System.Net.WebResponse.Close%2A> method should be called when the application is finished with the <xref:System.Net.WebResponse> stream.

MemberSignature.Value: public override System.Net.WebHeaderCollection Headers { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the collection of header name/value pairs associated with the request.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Package cache requests include a valid but otherwise empty header collection in their requests.
The <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackWebRequest.Headers%2A> property is shared with the inner <xref:System.Net.WebRequest> (<xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackWebRequest.GetInnerRequest%2A>).

MemberSignature.Value: public override string Method { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the protocol method to use with the pack URI request.
Docs.value: The protocol method name that performs this request.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackWebRequest.Method%2A> property returns an empty string if the request resolves from the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackageStore> cache. The <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackWebRequest.Method%2A> property is only set when request references an external Web request, such as http or ftp.
The <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackWebRequest.Method%2A> property is shared with the inner <xref:System.Net.WebRequest> (<xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackWebRequest.GetInnerRequest%2A>).

MemberSignature.Value: public override bool PreAuthenticate { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to preauthenticate the request.
Docs.value: to send a WWW-authenticate [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_http](~/includes/tlasharptla-http-md.md)] header with the initial request; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackWebRequest.PreAuthenticate%2A> property returns `false` for requests resolved from the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackageStore> cache; there is no pre-authentication scheme for the pack URI protocol.
The <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackWebRequest.PreAuthenticate%2A> property is shared with the inner <xref:System.Net.WebRequest> (<xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackWebRequest.GetInnerRequest%2A>).

MemberSignature.Value: public override System.Net.IWebProxy Proxy { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the network proxy for Internet access.
Docs.value: The to use for Internet access.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackWebRequest.Proxy%2A> property is shared with the inner <xref:System.Net.WebRequest> (<xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackWebRequest.GetInnerRequest%2A>).

Docs.summary: Gets the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] of the resource associated with the request.
Docs.value: The [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_uri](~/includes/tlasharptla-uri-md.md)] of the resource associated with the request.

MemberSignature.Value: public override int Timeout { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the length of time before the request times out.
Docs.value: The number of milliseconds to wait before the request times out.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Requests to the package cache do not time out. For requests that resolve from the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackageStore> cache, <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackWebRequest.Timeout%2A> returns a value of –1.
The <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackWebRequest.Timeout%2A> property is shared with the inner request (<xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackWebRequest.GetInnerRequest%2A>).

MemberSignature.Value: public override bool UseDefaultCredentials { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the default authentication credentials.
Docs.value: The default authentication credentials to use with the pack URI request.
